taxonomy.definition: Financial support and funding allocated to scientific research and development activities.
Policies and measures aimed at promoting and securing key technology industries and supply chains.
Strategies addressing global technological competition and collaboration among countries.
Initiatives to nurture, attract, and retain skilled human resources in science and technology.
Policies promoting digital technologies, infrastructures, and new economy business models.
Support for research and development in life sciences, health technologies, and public health.
Efforts to build self-reliant innovation systems and enhance national technological standards.
Policies aimed at transforming traditional industries through informatization and sustainable development.
Development of innovation hubs, science parks, and regional technology clusters.
Measures to protect intellectual property rights and develop technology standards.
Frameworks and institutions guiding national science and technology policies and strategies.

coding_decision_rules: Assign the category based on the primary objective of the policy instrument as described in the text.
If a policy involves financial support specifically for research activities, code it under 'R&D Investment'.
Policies focusing on human capital development in science and technology should be coded as 'Innovation Talent Development'.
When a policy targets digital infrastructure or promotes digital economy growth, classify it under 'Digital Economy and Infrastructure'.
If a policy addresses multiple categories, assign the category that represents the main strategic focus or largest resource allocation.
